Maybe you could just ask for the schematic and get somebody else to build i=
t for you.=A0 Why inundate Frank with building all these radios?=A0 There a=
re lots of qualified electronics gurus out there that could make one up for=
 you.=A0 If I were Frank I would not want hundreds of people asking me to b=
uild their radios.=A0 That could get out of hand.




_____________________=
___________
From: "Fransen, Debbie" <debbie.fransen@...>
To: EVP-ITC@=
yahoogroups.com
Sent: Monday, June 1, 2009 7:16:14 AM
Subject: RE: [EVP-ITC=
] Different chip config.





There are alot of people who would like Frank=
 to make a box for them ( including me).
I think we would all furnish whate=
ver he needed or just purchase a box from him.
Frank doesn't want to sell a=
nything that is not perfected, but none of this is a guarantee
that you wil=
l get some kind of spirit communication.
I wonder if Chris Moon has thought=
 about how his profits are going to decline if Frank
makes boxes to sell ?
=
=A0

riety of Bisquick=AE mix. Get Recipes Savings Now.

ving a Frank's box, I would be more then glad to buy one from him should he=
 wish ever to make one for me, =A0I would like it's wood painted in an azur=
e blue trim please with the rest a natural=A0shade of Mahogany (if can be f=

From: Fransen, Debbie 
To: EVP-ITC@y=
ahoogroups .com 
Sent: Friday, May 29, 2009 7:45 AM
Subject: RE: [EVP-ITC] =
Different chip config.

Exactly my point... You don't charge anything for t=
he boxes
and Chris Moon charges people for using it....
If it's not perfect=
ed then Chris shouldn't charge either......
If he wasn't so public with it,=
 then people like me wouldn't dislike him so much.
=A0
The only people that=
 have your boxes (that the public hear about)
are the well known paranormal=
 groups and famous people.
I am sure that you have given boxes to researche=
rs who are not in the popular
paranormal community ,and don't want to be. T=
hose are the ones that should
get respect.=A0 And of course YOU are well re=
spected by us lowly researchers. ( Kissin up , so you won't get mad)
=A0
An=
d I am sure that you are sick of hearing about Chris Moon and how
alot of p=
eople thinks he sucks. And everyone wants a box......
But you have to expec=
t that. You are the only one out there that is honest and
doesn't want to b=
e famous.
I know this is like beating a dead horse, so I will shut up now..=
.. :)
=A0
=A0

Sent: Thursday, May 28, 2009 2:29:09 PM

Besides--I didn't like that=
 radio design, it's too complex, and the documentation is screwy. I did a s=
impler radio last night that should be better, simpler, cheaper, and cleare=
r sound. 


On Thu, May 28, 2009 at 5:41 AM, Elaine Coates <cozykat2003@ ya=
hoo.com> wrote:




The jpg for this schematic is kind of blurry in places.=
=A0 Is there any way a more clear copy could be send to me? I would be fore=
ver grateful.=A0 Thanks Frank - Elaine

From: Frank Sumption <purplealiengirl@ gmail.com>
To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups =
.com
Sent: Thursday, May 28, 2009 12:55:00 AM
Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Differ=
ent chip config.


http://purplealieng irl.tripod. com/ 


=A0However, it's=
 constantly changing. The radio I made tonight is very simple, and can sign=
ificantly simplify construction. I used to make the sweep and amplifier cir=
cuits, then use a commercial radio, like the 12-469, as a tuner. 

=A0The M=
K484 is follwed by a couple high impedence op amp stages to bring the audio=
 up to line levels. I haven't had time to do schematic yet. I draw the sche=
matics with MS paint, and they are stored as jpeg images, which isn't=A0the=
 best, but it makes them e-mailable. 

=A0Frank-S


On Wed, May 27, 2009 at=
 8:54 PM, Elaine Coates <cozykat2003@ yahoo.com> wrote:




Hi folks, I jus=
t joined this group.=A0 I was recently at the Lizzy Borden house in Massach=
usetts with Chris Moon and had a session with Frank's Box.=A0 The results w=
ere astounding.=A0 Is this the newest schematic for Frank's box?=A0 If so, =
is there a way to get a clearer copy of it?=A0 My son said he would build o=
ne for me and I have been searching for the schematic.=A0 Can anyone help? =
- Elaine




________________________________
From: Frank Sumption <purplea=
liengirl@ gmail.com>
To: evp-itc@yahoogroups .com; grassharp@yahoogrou ps.c=
om 

Sent: Wednesday, May 27, 2009 5:45:16 PM
Subject: [EVP-ITC] Different =
chip config. [1 Attachment]



=A0I think I followed an erroneous LM3820 la=
yout, so I'm going to breadboard this layout. Note the antenna input is now=
 on pin 12-11, this is the RF amp input, and pin 13 is the RF amp output, w=
hich feeds pin 1.

=A0'case anyone cares. 

=A0F-S

<DIV> However, it's constantly changing. The radio I made tonight i=
s very simple, and can significantly simplify construction. I used to make =
the sweep and amplifier circuits, then use a commercial radio, like the 12-=
469, as a tuner. </DIV>
<DIV> </DIV>
<DIV> The MK484 is follwed b=
y a couple high impedence op amp stages to bring the audio up to line level=
s. I haven't had time to do schematic yet. I draw the schematics with MS pa=
int, and they are stored as jpeg images, which isn't the best, but it =
makes them e-mailable. </DIV>

<DIV> I think I followed an erroneous LM3820 layout, so I'm go=
ing to breadboard this layout. Note the antenna input is now on pin 12-11, =
this is the RF amp input, and pin 13 is the RF amp output, which feeds pin =
1.</DIV>
